item.title: BDD style unit test names
item.description: A coupleofmy colleagues have been posting about how to name your unit tests based on this original postby Jay Fields. I think that test names are useful, especially when written in a BDDstyle expressing what a test is supposed to be doing. For example, in a C# NUnit test we might see the following as a test name: [Test] public void ShouldDoSomething() { // Code testing that we're doing something } I write all my tests like this and I’m often asked what the point of the ‘Should’ is, why not just name it ‘DoSomething’.
